容.definition: to hold; to contain; to allow; to tolerate; appearance; look; countenance

容下.definition: to hold; to admit; to accommodate; to tolerate

容不得.definition: unable to tolerate; intolerant; unable to bear sth

容光煥發.definition: face glowing (idiom); looking radiant; all smiles

容克.definition: Junker (German aristocracy); Jean-Claude Juncker (1954-), Luxembourgish politician, prime minister of Luxembourg 1995-2013, president of the European Commission 2014-2019

容受.definition: to tolerate; to accept (criticism, resignation etc); same as 容納接受|容纳接受[rong2 na4 jie1 shou4]

容城.definition: Rongcheng county in Baoding 保定[Bao3 ding4], Hebei

容城縣.definition: Rongcheng county in Baoding 保定[Bao3 ding4], Hebei

容忍.definition: to put up with; to tolerate

容易.definition: easy; straightforward; likely; liable to; apt to

容祖兒.definition: Joey Yung (1980-), Hong Kong pop singer and actress

容納.definition: to hold; to contain; to accommodate; to tolerate (different opinions)

容縣.definition: Rong county in Yulin 玉林[Yu4 lin2], Guangxi

容華絕代.definition: to be blessed with rare and radiant beauty (idiom)

容讓.definition: to make a concession; to be accommodating

容貌.definition: one's appearance; one's aspect; looks; features

容身.definition: to find a place where one can fit in; to make one's home; to seek shelter

容顏失色.definition: (of complexion) to lose one's color; to blanch; to look wan
